summary: States and the federal government share in financing Medicaid, a health care program for low-income and medically needy people. States mostly use their general funds to finance the nonfederal share, but they can also use funds from care providers and local governments. From 2008 to 2018, states relied more heavily on the other funds. Since the federal government matches all nonfederal funds, responsibility for a...
title: Medicaid: CMS Needs More Information on States' Financing and Payment Arrangements to Improve Oversight
